Reviews.Title: “Very basic, great location, very laid back-”
Reviews.Author: BlackBlake
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rookies for 3 nights. Rooms are basic, but had bathroom and basic amenities. Right of a nice shopping/restaurant/metro stop (leidesplein). Coffee shop right next door, sells drinks, desserts and plenty of pot. Friendly pot/travelers staying there, lots of smell but if your a smoker its fine, just open your window. Basic breakfast came with room. In a coffee shop district, but not in what most people think of as the red light district with the girls, thats a 15/20 minute walk. Nice to be a little out of the way tho, and plenty of things to do in the immediate area, van gogh, other big museum i cant spell, tulip market... all in appropriate hotel for a wild couple days in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, cigarretes, but very nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: romeuvictor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, close to Leidsplein. If you have large and heavy luggages, be prepared to take them upstairs. In my case, the reception desk man helped me and it was okay. Rooms smelled like cigarretes and bathrooms were in flood after a few minutes of shower. The bed is comfortable and the breakfast is nice. The staff in this hotel is very nice. I went in the winter, so I could not really enjoy the balcony outside. At nights, it was easy to hear noisy groups talking out loud. Anyway, the price is good in AmsterdamÂ´s standards and it was okay for me.

Reviews.Title: “Cannabis Cup 2011- RETURN OF THE BHOYS.”
Reviews.Author: Glenn S
Reviews.Content: I said I would be back so here I am, arrived 22nd Nov & stayed till 24th, came back for Cannabis Cup with friends,my friends went onto "the mushrooms"(nightmare) & I stuck with the weed(oh yes!), this stay we had 2 (newly renovated & spotless rooms), both were renovated to a high standard.As ever, the staff are second to none.Free Wi-Fi in rooms & downstairs coffee shop still a nice bonus. As we say "I just can`t get enough" of this very friendly Hotel.Hoping to be back in March for a HOOT!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at The Rookies”
Reviews.Author: fasttravellers
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this hotel, and wont be the last. Got the same room we did the last time, and John gave us a good price, since we were returning customers :) Since last time the room had been painted, the windows changed, and the bathroom retiled. It looked really nice. There were a lot of work going on in the building, so we guess it will look even better soon. We didnt get to try the breafast this time, but we are sure that it tasted as good as it did the last time.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT WEEKEND”
Reviews.Author: Glenn S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 22/10/11 to 24/10/11;first time in this Hotel & will not be the last.wee John on reception was very helpfull & could not do enough for me.staff in downstairs coffee shop were also very good.My room was very clean & warm,bed was very comfortable too.Free wi-fi was a nice bonus.Location is spot on & anything you want to do is only a short walk away.Renovations have started & I was shown finished upgraded rooms(very nice). My return flight was at 21.45hrs from schiphol & I was able to hold room till 18.00hrs for a very small fee, this I really appreciated. As a frequent visitor to Amsterdam I cannot wait to return here to Rookies ,and I will always stay here in future.Thank you once again for everything.Glenn Scolley from Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to chill and relax”
Reviews.Author: Hell64
Reviews.Content: Beds were comfortable. Room and en-suite were very clean. Bloke on reception was very polite and helpful. Hotel was undergoing a major refurb while we were there but it was not a major inconvenience. Would definitely go back and stay and would recommend to friends. Stairs were steep but what do you expect from a traditional dutch building. Nice patio area to chill in.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of it all!”
Reviews.Author: RosandPaul
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us from a friend.Although the stairs are steep and atmosphere is laid back,we found everything we needed here.The reception was welcoming ,our room was clean and we were central to all Amsterdam has to offer.The breakfast was a great start and theres a patio off the reception area,very peaceful. If your looking for simple,clean and friendly lodging in the middle of Amsterdam than this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Amsterdam stay”
Reviews.Author: travelsquirrel9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights and was very happy with my choice. The hotel is close to all that is happening in Leidseplein, the entertainment area of Amsterdam. I am in my 40s and not much into partying anymore but it was nice to be able to step out of the hotel and get something to eat or drink close by whenever I felt like it. Some reviewers seem to have had a problem with noise, and John at reception did enquire if it was too noisy for me, but I really didn't notice the noise on the weekend once I closed my window, and I was in a room right at the front. Having mentioned John, I must say he was the most friendly and helpful host I could have asked for. He checked with me every day as to how I was going, and as a solo traveller I appreciate that. The breakfast was just right, all you could want from scrambled eggs to toast, coffee, tea, juice, cereals, cheese and cold meat. Previous reviewers have mentioned the difficult stairways - yes, it's Amsterdam, there are difficult stairways. The staff were very helpful and insisted on carrying my (very heavy) bag up and down the stairs. The room was spacious and very clean. It was cleaned daily and I had a hard time convincing the cleaning guy that I did not need new towels every day! The location was excellent, so close to all the sights, just a short walk away or catch the trams nearby. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it. I must note, the hotel is above a coffee shop (which in Amsterdam means a place where you smoke pot) and it is allowed to smoke in the rooms. The smell was quite strong in the hallways but I did not notice it at all in my room. I do not smoke pot but this did not bother me in the slightest - you have to remember it is legal there. Don't bring your hang-ups with you to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “It`s not the Ritz - but it aint trying to be either...We liked it!!”
Reviews.Author: fasttravellers
Reviews.Content: We had a really good time at the Rookies. Loved the fact that it was smoker friendly, so we could do what we came to do in the room. We had a superior room with a great wiew over the cosy backyard, but the only superior about it was that it had its own bathroom. The room was clean when we came, and they changed the towels during our stay. If you want, you can get your room cleaned during the stay, but you have to order it in the reception. The room was spaceful, and the mattresses was good, only bad thing was that the beds kept sliding apart, and left me feeling so lonely with my boyfriend all the way over on the other side :) There was no hairdryer or ironing board, but you could borrow it if you needed to. The only thing we missed in the room was a small refrigerator for drinks and stuff. The reception is not open 24 hours, but we didnt find any difficulties with it because the coffeshop down starirs are open until 01.00 am and the staff there are happy to help you with anything you might need help with. They also provide very good regular ,and amsterdam coffe in the coffeshop :) Breakfast was good, but plain. Two kinds of bread and some different kinds of cheese, jams and ham. They also offered to make scrambled eggs if you wanted to. Coffe and tea of course, and the breakfast was included in the price. The location couldnt have been better, nice atmosphere and lots of good restaurants, bars, cafes and coffeshops around. Impulsive preformances in the streets wich we think is very cosy and fun. Also a very good area for shopping, LOTS of independent stores as well as the big ones like H&M. Loved it, and would really like to come back to the Rookies and John, wich was a really nice guy, again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, Dirty!!”
Reviews.Author: meganhtn
Reviews.Content: Having been to Amsterdam several times before, i decided the rookies uptown would be a good choice as it was in the heart of the city and close o the restaurants and attractions When i arrived we lead up a very narrow and steep staircase just to get to recpetion, which was actually the dining room-come-breakfast area. There was also i strong smell from the coffee shop down stairs. The floor and carpets were unkept and in need of vacumming. We were then told he did not need to see our passports, thought this was strange seeing as i have always been asked to produce this before. He lead us to our room which was on the third floor again up a narrow, steep and winding staircase (which is typical of amsterdam, but definetly not suitable for the elderly or disabled). The room was small and barely room enough to walk around, and there was no space to store out two suitcases. The room smelt of stale smoke and cananbis. The floor again was dirty and was covered in crumbs. Under the beds where cigarette ends. The net curtains were stained grey and the window ledge was also black and grimey. The whole room was just dark and dingy, we had two over-bed lights, a lamp and the ceiling light on and it was still dull. The towels we were given were stained and smelt musty. The bedclothes were also worn and there were crumbs and hairs inside when we pulled the sheets back. The door would not lock properly, leaving us feeling uneasy. The reception was never manned, you had to go outside of the hotel, out into the street and into the coffee shop to get the receptionist to come into the hotel. The whole establishment was very poorly run and not mantained at all. I would never recomment this hotel. Go to the best western museum appollo! same price and its the lap of luxry compared!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Stevo
Reviews.Content: If i could give this review a minus out of 10 i would!!!! I stayed here first weekend in February from Friday to Monday. As soon as we arrived at the hotel it was apparent that it was unclean! We thought we would wait and see what the room was like......and OH MY! The room was sooooo DIRTY it was unbelievable, the window and radiator was black! The walls and furniture was stained with what I donâ€™t know! The towels they gave us where white (Well I say white i mean, grey with black stains on and human hair!) The carpet hadnâ€™t been hovered in about 100 years, there was cigarette buds under the bed. The bed itself had hairs under the covers and even on the pillow. The room just generally smelt of I donâ€™t know what and the bath room was even worse! As it was late we couldnâ€™t move to another hotel that night so we had no other choice to stay! The worst nightâ€™s sleep I have ever had, slept fully clothed as I didnâ€™t want any part of my body touching the dirty sheets, i kept waking up in the middle of the night to the stench of the room! I also managed to push our room door open from the outside even though it had been doubled locked. As i was travelling with just my friend it was very unnerving to say the least! As soon as it hit 8am we were out the door and into a CLEAN hotel around the corner. The only decent thing was we got some of our money back. The Manager never asked to see the room after the complaint and we didnâ€™t even have to ask for our money back, he must have known deep down what state the room was in! My advice, STAY AWAY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hostel at best and incredibly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: omartennis
Reviews.Content: Do not think this is any more than a student hostel. It would be unfair not to mention upfront that the guy at the desk is exceptional in terms of helpfulness and warmth. However, that does not make up for the fact that I paid â‚¬117 for 1 night in a cramped, incredibly noisy (up to 4am! on a Friday night) room, albeit I understand the rooms at the back are quieter than those on the boulevard, which has a plethora of bars and restaurants. If I had paid â‚¬20-30 then I wouldn't expect much more. You should be aware that the hotel is above a "coffee shop" which does give the whole hostel a distinct "Amsterdam odour"! The room was very poorly lit so impossible to do any work and was very small, especially the bathroom (even for a hostel"). However, worse than that was the bed-bug bites I got, which struck me as being a sign of very poor cleanliness. The location is good for Museums but do not expect to get any sleep at night if you're at the front! I'm sorry but for the money you should get a lot more than this.

Reviews.Title: “great place nice owners too”
Reviews.Author: viewsonic321
Reviews.Content: part of a coffee shop so if your into this type of thing great if not still great as location in quite part which i like but not far away too busy area about 30 seconds away would go back here for sure top place

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for sightseeing and nightlife.”
Reviews.Author: cube33
Reviews.Content: The Rookies is a brilliant hotel. The room was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The only negative is that the Coffee Shop downstairs doesn't serve beer. Hardly a complaint really! Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great find....wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: saudiRT
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, I chose the Hotel Rookies in Amsterdam and I do not regret one minute. Before my arrival, I emailed John many times with many questions. He was always gracious and answered all my questions fully. Before arriving to the city, I receive an email from John stating that he had arranged transportation from the airport to the hotel. Great little surprise! Upon arrival at the hotel, I checked into my first room which was for me a bit noisy as it was facing the street. The next day, I was moved to a room on the 3rd flr in the back and that was just wonderful.While the steps are initially daunting, John was there to take my bags up to my room, both times, and then to the car upon my departure. He is such a lovely man! The morning breakfast was a great addition and John's scrambled eggs were the best. The hotel is close enough to everything but far enough from the hustle/bustle. I would strongly recommend this hotel as a great affordable option in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: scottcowan
Reviews.Content: the only hotel i have stayed in twice, one of the friendliest . but take your own kettle and cup.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive for what is less than a one star”
Reviews.Author: connaisseur78
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a tiny single room which was like 7m2 that cost me 85â‚¬ a night a real rip off. The staff is nice, but it doesnt make it to be a nice hotel. Breakfast VERY basic and boring. My bathroom was a nightmare with the shower that couldnt work properly. It was not a real shower, i was showering on the floor. it would have been ok if the room would have costed 25â‚¬. But Amsterdam is damn expensive. Location was central, in a loud busy area, but central.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, clean, no frills. I'd recommended to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: morbidmini
Reviews.Content: We stayed in rookies for 6 days, we had initially booked for 4 days. But due to unforeseen circumstances we added 2 extra nights. We were late (11pm) checking in as our flight had been badly delayed but we just asked the staff in the coffee shop who gladly took our bags and check us in as reception had closed. Our 1st room on the 3rd was small but had a good size bathroom and was incredibly clean. The receptionist John was very friendly and couldnâ€™t do enough for us. We were supposed to change rooms for the final 2 evenings as its originally the planned length of the stay, but the receptionist seen I have walking difficulties and asked if we would like to move into another room which was available on the 2nd floor with a bath rather than a shower on the second day of our stay. The 2nd room was much bigger than and just as clean as the 1st room. On the day of our check out, our flight was not until early evening and when asking if we could keep our bags in reception and were told that if we wanted we could have a late check out at no extra charge, which was very much appreciated. We were not expecting it to be luxurious for the price we paid, but the cleanliness of the rooms and friendliness of the staff more than made up for it. It's location is close enough to leidseplein to have a great evening out without travelling too far but far enough away to have a good sleep, it was a bit noisier at the weekend but that is to be expected it such a popular city. There is a small supermarket close by and plenty of restaurants in the immediate area. And of course, the coffee shop just down the stairs is a winner every time if you are that way inclined. I would definitely stay in this hotel if I visit Amsterdam again, and hopefully will.

Reviews.Title: “excellent price, great location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: CJ_FS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rookies (previously Uptown) Hotel for four nights, having been recommended as it is so close to the Paradiso, and we were in town for a concert. We've never been to Amsterdam before, so we wanted to be centrally located, and this hotel is right in the trendy area of Leidseplein. The owners made us so welcome - warm, cosy but spacious bedroom, comfy bed, new fluffy towels, tiny but functional scandinavian style bathroom, big windows overlooking the street from this charming old Amsterdam house (steep stairs!). Being a lively part of town, there's some 'social' noise on the weekends, but in a pedestrian street, there's no traffic or tram noise ! Breakfast was great, they made us the best cheese omelette ever ! Definitely want to come and stay here again... Cathy & FranÃ§ois, Strasbourg

Reviews.Title: “pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: DrDBA
Reviews.Content: a self-described 2-star hotel, rookies fills the bill Rob, one of the hotel keepers, is a 5-star guy with outstanding hospitality the hotel is too damn loud. on the weekends the street noise lasts until after 4 am. the internal noise is worse with the loud banging of hotel room and hallway doors. the breakfast rates 1star; it's best for coffee and juice only. there is lots of potential in the property that a good paint job, new carpeting, and cleaning up the back deck could do wonders for. excellent location and very steep steps, as previously mentioned. overall: 2 stars (without Rob it falls to 1 star)

Reviews.Title: “Rookie's Rocked!”
Reviews.Author: SunWorshipperJen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Uptown, or Rookies as it is now more effectionatlly known was ideal for our needs as a crash pad for somewhere to stay during our short break to the Dam in April 2008. The phrase you get what you pay for very much rings true here - which was fine as I assume most people visiting Amsterdam are not planning on spending much time in their rooms anyway! The hotel was well equipped & clean, and the rooms a fair size for your money. Only negative would be the steep steps to get to the rooms (especially with my heavy case!) which were situated above the Rookies coffee shop (a very nice cafe, with a lot of selection - just to add!). John on reception was very welcoming, if a bit eccentric but that all added to our Amsterdam experience! He was more than happy to give us advice on where to go and what to do... Breakie in the hotel was typical continential which was quite nice. Located in the centre of town, everything was very accessable. I have read the hotel would be noisy where it is located in a lively area but I didn't hear a thing once our room door was closed. The main rail station was a short tram ride away, and getting around Amsterdam from the Rookies was a doddle! I'd highly recommend The Rookies for your short break to the Dam... just watch those stairs if you come in from a night on the Grolsch!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: NicevilleViajeros
Reviews.Content: Came to visit Amsterdam and wanted to stay close to the Leidseplein. Our room was a double. It was quite small but had a wonderful view and was clean (except for a bad water stain by the bathroom door). The breakfast was included and very good. The front desk guy was very nice and helpful with directions and things to do. Our room was on the third floor, to the back. The stairs are a killer (very steep) but kept us in shape. Did I mention location? We walked everywhere. The flower shops, restaurants, bars all are within walking distance. And then there is the Rookieâ€™s coffee shop just downstairs. The best coffee and super nice staff

Reviews.Title: “First stay at Rookies”
Reviews.Author: cgclearman
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 6 day visit to Amsterdam and stayed at the Rookies Hotel. We found the hotel to be clean and fine for the price paid. We have stayed in Amsterdam twice before, once at one of the big hotels on Damrak and the other time in a canal house at the seven bridges. The Rookies Hotel was nothing like the either of these two places, but then we didn't expect it to be. For the price paid it exactly what you would expect. The rooms are small, but it is Amsterdam. The room was always clean, sheets were changed regularly and the managers at the hotel were very kind and helpful. The location of the hotel is very convenient. Be aware that this part of town can be noisy late at night. We were there in early October, so the noise wasn't as bad as other times of the year. If you are looking for a good budget hotel to stay in, we would recommend the Rookies Hotel. If you want upscale lodging, you probably want to keep looking.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Loch Lomond and The Trossachs National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday - Again”
Reviews.Author: JaneF
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Rookies in July of this year for six nights. We visited this hotel in August of last year. This time we had requested a room at the back of the property as we had found on our previous visit rooms at the front were very noisy. We were delighted when they had met our request. Our room was cleaned each day and fresh towels provided, there was also a TV which had an assortment of channels including BBC1. The breakfast provided was typically continental, but sufficient enough and we were able to enjoy breakfast outside most mornings. On our previous visit, the hotel owned the restaurant over the street, however, this has now been sold on. Their coffee shop has made some adjustments to accommodate tobacco smokers, there are now few establishments that offer this facility. The location of the hotel is superb, it is in a nice area of Amsterdam, there are plenty of restaurants, bars and shops around and within walking distance to Amsterdam Central. There is also a small shop next to the hotel which is open to 10.3/11.00pm each night, which is handy when you have a hunger attack. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay again and will definitely be returning to Hotel Rookies on our next visit to Amsterdam. The staff (especially Rob) are extremely helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Average - Beware of the Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: rachyf
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights at the weekend. First impressions where the very steep stairs up to the reception on the first floor. Easy check in with John very friendly. Then we where informed of the bad news our room was on the fourth Floor...yes again that meant walking up them dreadful stairs. The room looked clean and well presented on the first look...but look deeper... The room was very small...enough room to walk around the bed though. The sheets looked clean, as they where white.. Bathroom was very very small, but we managed to cope for the 4 days. On the 2nd day, I started get these red lumps (very itchy) turns out there was bed bugs!!! Yuck. I am covered and so is my boyfriend. That put me off immediately. Plus one evening we where walking about in our bare feet and my fella screamed, and there was a rusty nail sticking up out of the floor. The location of the hotel is excellent. It took less than a minute to walk to the main square of Leidesplein and about 15minutes walk to Dam Sqaure. The hotel would be fine for those wishing to make alot of use of the local coffeeshops, but for those wishing to have a nice weekend away, stay in a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thief”
Reviews.Author: simon1970Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: Tired, small, dirty over priced rooms !!! Beware travellers the owner Billy is a thief he stole cash and a mobile phone out of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Stic77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May with a friend of mine, he had stayed before and recommended it highly. The location is fantastic, the room was immaculate and the staff were great - slightly crazy, in a good way (to be expected given the kind of hotel it is)! We had a deluxe twin with bath, the beds were very comfortable, towels and hairdryer provided, tv in the room, digital safe.. everything you need. My friend is vegan, and they got us both fresh fruit smoothies every morning for breakfast. Delicious! There was plenty of toast, jam and cereal too. There was a carnivore there at the same time, they were cooking him omlettes and he was tucking into the meat and cheese continental breakfast too, so everyone is catered for. Coffee was nice too! The decking out the back is a great place to sit in the afternoon, and downstairs, Rookies itself is a lovely place for a coffee :) The stairs up to the hotel are a bit intimidating at first, but after 2 days I was not even holding into the handrail, they look worse than they actually are. I'm one of the clumsiest people ever, and I didn't have a problem! I loved it so much that we have already booked up for New Year, can't wait! I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Amsterdam. Go to Amsterdam! And stay at Rookies!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: phastings
Reviews.Content: I had no hand in choosing this hotel, so I was nervous of its suitability to begin with, however my traveling companions had done themselves proud with their choice. Hotel Uptown shares its management with the The Rookies Coffee Shop, which is in itself a great place to hang out, and is a great place to wait for those in your group who like to sleep in, as it is directly underneath the Hotel. Because of this you may hear the hotel referred to as Hotel Uptown / The Rookies in some booking sites. Fear ye not, it is the same Hotel! We arrived much earlier than normal check-in time, but the man behind the reception desk was flexible and accommodating. He gave us the key to a room that had been vacated earlier that morning so that we could securely stow our luggage, and then by the time we had explored and had some lunch, he had already transferred our bags to our actual room. We had booked a luxury twin (as per the continental standard, a double wasn't an option), and while it isn't Dorchester-style luxury, you do get a nice bath instead of just a shower. The beds were lightweight, so they did tend to slide apart sometimes, but again, its par for the course in a continental B&B. The rest of the room was pleasantly decorated, and had plenty of storage space, while the bathroom was bigger than our one at home! There is a TV in the room, with BBC1 and the ubiquitous BBC World, as well as a phone. Breakfast was a buffet of cereal, bread, hams and cheese. Watch the toaster - it's got one hell of a spring on it and I lost one of my slices of toast down the side of the counter! I also had scrambled eggs cooked to order, and the Amsterdam standard of choosing from a plethora of flavoured tea bags to add to your cup of hot water was followed. There are no objections to taking food or drink from breakfast back up to the room, so there was no issue with the fact that my other half didn't manage to leave the room before 10am on any of the three mornings we were there. In terms of location, not only is there the cosy Rookies below the hotel, but next door there is a small supermarket, and the Leidse Plein is only at the end of the street, which during the day is exceptionally quiet, but at night (especially at weekends) turns into one of the main drags for bars and clubs. This can get noisy, so be prepared for a slightly restless Friday and Saturday night if you are not one of the revellers. All in all a perfect base camp for a few days of sight seeing!

Reviews.Title: “rookies review”
Reviews.Author: warthog77
Reviews.Content: stayed at the rookies hotel and found it to be exactly what I expected. It is a great value for the money, just do not expect 3 or 4 stars. The room was a tad small(but very clean) for a single, but it is amsterdam and I expected that. The staff was very friendly and helpful. This hotel is geared more to the under 50 crowd. It is on a very lively street so don't expect peace and quiet. The entrance is very very steep!! so if you over-indulge and try to navigate the stairs be warned, I can just imagine the number of folks that have taken a spill !!! The coffeeshop was just terrific, very friendly and reasonably priced. Its worth the trip just to shop there. Overall great value just not the place I would take someone special for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Really good experience”
Reviews.Author: DanandTan
Reviews.Content: 10 of us stayed at the Hotel Rookies (Hotel Uptown as it used to be called) for a stag weekend. The hotel was quite far out, probably about 30 minutes walk from Centraal Station but with easy access to Trams and Taxis its not a problem, in fact I'd rather stay here than closer to the Centre. Our rooms were a good size and pretty modern and most importantly very clean. The people running it were extremely friendly and helpful. The price is very reasonable and includes a nice breakfast. Overall I'm really pleased we chose this hotel, its on a pretty lively street and close to the Museums. Very much recommended and I look forward to returning

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Rookies.”
Reviews.Author: Fourb2
Reviews.Content: I was very taken with this small and well located hotel. Arriving around 11am after a 12 hour flight, I was met at reception by John. Now John is a strangely engaging fellow, whose quick wit was always amusing. I had requested a room at the "back" of the hotel which was a good move for me because it got me into double on the 3rd floor (room 3.4) for the first 2 of 3 days spent there. Nice view to the rear of the property, with the only real noise being from little kids playing on the swings in a property at the rear. The room was larger than expected, very clean, had a room safe, comfy beds, TV with reasonable channel selection, and a practical bathroom including a tub. After a nice hot shower, with good water pressure, I was a new man, in need of a coffee, so I ventured downstairs (and next door) to the Rookies coffeeshop, which is worth a visit as well. The stairs weren't quite the challenge I'd expected, and the hand rail offers good support. The hotel is situated above the very roomy, "quite" friendly, and well equipped Rookies coffeeshop. Also just accross the lane is the Rookies Bar & Grill where a 10oz Heineken will set you back EU$2.10. Note that the bar (as well as the hotel) is "smoker" friendly. The little area at the rear of the bar, over-looks a canal and is ideal for sipping beers or even a meal. Breakfast (now served in the small but quaint dining room in the hotel reception area) was well presented and DO remember that JOHN loves to cook eggs to your personal preference if asked. Toast, jam, cheese, cold meat, cereal, milk, coffee, tea and juice are all there on offer as well. Trams 1, 2, and 5 will get you from Central to Leidseplain, then follow your nose down Korte Leidsedwarsstraat for a couple of hundred meters to the Hotel. Plenty of culinary options nearby, as well as several famous attractions all within easy walking distance. The small convenience store right beside the hotel is perfect for late night munchies. I payed EU$65 per night for a single room, booking directly with the hotel, and left there feeling like I'd robbed them. A very fair price indeed. On my third night I knew I had to change to a REAL "single" room as the hotel was filling up. John offered me one at the rear on the 4th floor. In the end I decided to take the room often critisised at the FRONT on the floor above the coffeeshop. I took it mostly out of fair play for having had such a nice room for the first 2 days at the single room rate. I feared the noise would annoy me... It didn't, in fact it was kinda cool to kick back in the room and watch the world going by outside. That said, this room is very small, but still adequate for one person. The noise factor was minimal. Reception closes about 6pm, after which you use the small electronic tag thingy on your room key-ring to access the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amongst many stays in the Dam”
Reviews.Author: DetroitJim
Reviews.Content: The stay at the Hotel Uptown/Rookies was typically great. I have staryed here no less than 5 times and have had excellent service every time. The staff remembers me by name and addresses me every time I arrive in a very cordial manner. Especially helpful is John, who always goes the extra mile for me. This is the best value for the money that I have found in Amsterdam. I have stayed in the Grand Krasnopolsky, and have stayed here. Stay here and save your money

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay - Still Recommend It!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaCP
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Hotel Uptown/Hotel Rookies. We stay at this property specifically because of their liberal smoking policies. We will continue to return because of those policies, the rates, the value and the location. This is an easy ride from Centraal Station to Leidseplein or back to Centraal Station on the 1, 4 or 5 trams. From the tram stop, it's no more than a 5 minute walk to the Hotel. Check in/out was easy, and the desk staff helpful. Breakfast is across the street in its restaurant, and is adequate. Wi-Fi is free, but you will need to give the staff your computer ip(?) address for access to the signal. We had the luxury double, and it was clean and comfortable and quiet (last time we faced the street during world cup - not so quiet in the summer). The location is excellent if your goal is the museums and Vondel Park. The location is just fine for us for almost everything else - but we generally walk at least 5 miles a day, and usually more like 8 miles a day. But again, tram service is readily available if you aren't inclined to walk. Get a strippenkart for the tram and everything is within an easy distance. The patio in the back is one of my favorite features - we like to sit out there and smoke and check e-mail, update our website or write out post cards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the (Uptowon) Rookies”
Reviews.Author: YoungFrenchCouple
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel situated in the Leidseplein area, with plenty of bars and restaurants. The location is perfect to visit the city, a walking distance from all major sites. We had a nice Luxury Twin room overlooking the beautiful hotel's terrace. The room was nice, larger than the Amsterdam standards,quiet and clean. There's a desk, a cupboard with a safe, and the beds are comfortable. Large bathroom with a tub, wich is rather unusual in hotels. The owner was friendly and helpful, and being a small hotel, there's a "family atmosphere" that makes you feel at ease. A great experience, we will definitely stay there next time we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, fun and great location”
Reviews.Author: eurotravelman
Reviews.Content: This hotel, now simply referred to as The Rookies Hotel(right off Leidseplein about 30 seconds walk to the square), has made some changes (adding the separate bar and restaurant) due to new local rules about serving alcohol in coffee shops. The hotel is above it's coffee shop, but the room we stayed in (23) was excellent, large, facing the back, and had a huge bathroom, with views to a small courtyard and The Rookie's private patio behind. Even the bathroom had a swinging door window that you could open up so that while you rested and painfully remove last night's Doner/Kebab (stay away from hot sauce), you could peacefully look at the trees out back and hear the birds sing. The bathroom was a major success, where you dont have to tuck your elbow's in just to dry yourself off! It's huge!! I will always ask for this room, it's quiet and fantastic (it's just roughly 5-10 euro each more per night). The only difference now is that you have to head across the very narrow street to the Rookies Restaurant to get your beer, as opposed to sitting at their coffee shop to smoke and sip your beer. But it didnt matter; we grabbed the smoke and did that with the beer at the restaurant seats out front of it!! No big deal!! I have been to Amsterdam 6-7 times, and this was by far the biggest room and bathroom yet. (and I usually will travel with one or two others and anything off or near Leidseplein will set you back 50euro or more each for two star and up...from my research anyway....). Staff is excellent and friendly too!! there is also a newer Smart Shop right next to it and a gift shop across. You have everything within 2 seconds, even a small little grociery store two doors down!!

Reviews.Title: “free wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: jinks420
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Uptown or Rookies Hotel as it now called is a small hotel with the usual steep stairs. The rooms are not a bad size by British standards but Americans will find them a bit on the small size.Free Wi-Fi in the rooms is a bonus as some of the other hotels I have stayed in charge up to 30 euros per day. The Rookies coffeeshop downstairs is one I would visit even if I was not staying there.So another bonus smoking weed in the hotel room is permitted.Small shop next door for stocking up on munchies and beer. So many places to eat,drink and smoke with in a couple of mins walk. I have booked 11 nights over xmas and new year so could be another report to come.

Reviews.Title: “Shhh. Keep it as a secret!”
Reviews.Author: Xaf
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is not exactly a cheap place if we talk about hotels so finding a little gem like the Uptown is wonderful. Is almost perfectly placed just next to Ledseplein but as far as you won't be disturbed. Rooms are quite basic but even more clean than 4 and 5 star hotels I've stayed. Breakfast is also quite basic but enough for my taste. A couple of cold cuts, cheese, corn-flakes, toats, milk, coffe and orange juice. Fried eggs and omelettes are prepared at the moment. There is also a nice "patio" on the back where you can relax. The staff is a "must". They are fun and very kind, always trying to help you. The only bad point I found was that my room (102) was just on of a table of the coffeshop, so in the summer could be really noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, nice price, but....”
Reviews.Author: stu20001
Reviews.Content: For a crash pad for a weekend in Amsterdam this is a good choice. The location is very handy - just a couple of hundred yards off the Leidseplein so close to some good bars, restaurants and clubs but not so close that you are too disturbed at night. Rookies coffeeshop on the ground floor is one of the nicest ones in the city with a real pub-like atmosphere and a pool table. It wasn't a bad price and compared to where some other members of our group stayed it was like a Hilton or something. The only real downside was returning home to find myself covered in flea bites. I can't say for definite they came from the hotel though which I must point out seemed really clean on the whole, but no-one else I went with suffered and I was the only one to stay at Uptown.

Reviews.Title: “I would definately go back....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last time I went to Amsterdam, I paid the same amount and ended up in a really grotty room I was scared hadn't seen a clean in months!! This time I went to Amsterdam I was overjoyed with the Hotel Uptown. The first thing you find upon checking in is the beautiful little terrace they have out back, a perfect spot for breakfast in the morning or an afternoon coffee if just wanting some chill time. The rooms, although not huge, are really clean and tidy and anything not found in the room (i.e iron, hairdryer) can be provided by the staff. The location is perfect...is is in one of the busiest night-life spots in the city, so is great if you need to stumble home after the bar. However, it is stumbling distance enough to get you away from the main noise of this area, and the room remains quiet and peceful even at night. You are right by the main canals so a stroll up the Princegraht towards Jordaan is the perfect thing to do during the day, stopping for a few yummy beers along the way. The Hieneken brewery is around the corner too. Overall, I advise anyone looking for a cheapish hotel in a really good location, with friendly staff and clean, basic rooms....choose the Hotel Uptown - now the Hotel Rookies! The coffee shop downstairs is a fun place to hangout too!! ;0)

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel The Rookies
HotelInfo.Address: Korte Leidsedwarsstraat 147, Amsterdam 1017 PZ, The Netherlands (Formerly Hotel Uptown)
